TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ProxyWebPart extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart

Docs.summary: Represents the base class for Web Parts controls that under certain conditions must replace other Web Parts controls on a page.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ProxyWebPart is the base class for a set of Web Parts controls, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.UnauthorizedWebPart> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ErrorWebPart>, that can be used as placeholders for other Web Parts controls on a page. Typically, a ProxyWebPart control will replace another Web Parts control when some type of error or failure has occurred. For example, when a user is not authorized to view a Web Parts control on a page, the intended Web Parts control is replaced with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.UnauthorizedWebPart> control. When a Web Parts control cannot be loaded or a new instance of it cannot be created, the original Web Parts control is replaced with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ErrorWebPart> control. If the intended Web Parts control later becomes available to the user, it will be restored to the page and the object derived from the ProxyWebPart class will be removed.
The ProxyWebPart class does not save view state or control state. If a Web Parts control is replaced by a ProxyWebPart object and then later becomes available, its view state and control state will be empty.
The ProxyWebPart object preserves personalization data for the Web Parts control that it replaced. If the original Web Parts control becomes available, its personalization data will be restored.
When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control saves personalization data, it does not save the properties of a ProxyWebPart object. Instead, it saves the properties of the control that the ProxyWebPart object replaced. If the original Web Parts control becomes available, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control will automatically load it.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartCollection> object contains the ProxyWebPart object. The ID of the intended Web Parts control can be retrieved from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPart.OriginalID%2A> property or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPart.GenericWebPartID%2A> property.
If a ProxyWebPart object replaces a Web Parts control that is either the provider or consumer of a Web Parts connection, the connection is not activated but will not be deleted. If the original Web Parts control becomes available, the connection will be reactivated.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart) cil managed

Docs.param: The Web Parts control to be replaced.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class when a static Web Parts control (or server or user control) must be replaced.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is used to create a proxy Web Parts control to replace a static Web Parts control. To replace a dynamically created Web Parts control, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPart.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%29> constructor to create the proxy Web Parts control.

Docs.exception:
has an empty <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property
\- or -
is an empty
\- or -
is of type and its child control has an empty <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property

MemberSignature.Value: protected ProxyWebPart (string originalID, string originalTypeName, string originalPath, string genericWebPartID);
.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string originalID, string originalTypeName, string originalPath, string genericWebPartID) cil managed

Docs.param: A string that is the control ID (not the unique ID) of the control to replace. If a control is replaced, the ID is the ID of its child server control.
A string that is the name of the <xref:System.Type> of the control to replace. If a control is replaced, the type name is the type of its child server control.
A string that contains the path to the user control to replace.
A string that returns the ID of a control, if that type of control is being replaced. This is needed for controls that do not inherit from the base class.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class when a dynamic Web Parts control must be replaced.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is used to create a proxy Web Parts control to replace a dynamic Web Parts control. To replace a static Web Parts control, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPart.%23ctor%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart%29> constructor to create a proxy Web Parts control.

Docs.exception: is specified but is or an empty string.

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.GenericWebPart.ID%2A> property from the generic Web Parts control replaced by a proxy Web Parts control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPart> object replaces a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.GenericWebPart> control, this property contains the value from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.GenericWebPart.ID%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

MemberSignature.Value: public override sealed string ID { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the programmatic identifier assigned to the Web Parts control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPart> object will contain the same value in its ID property as the control it replaced.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance void LoadControlState(object savedState) cil managed

Docs.summary: Overrides <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.LoadControlState%2A> to prevent loading previously saved state for a object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The LoadControlState method overrides <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.LoadControlState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to prevent loading the control state. The method does not load the control state or perform any other action.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void LoadViewState(object savedState) cil managed

Docs.summary: Overrides <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.LoadViewState%2A> to prevent loading previously saved view state for a object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The LoadViewState method overrides <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.LoadViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to prevent loading the view state. The method does not load the view state or perform any other action.

Docs.summary: Gets the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> of the Web Parts control replaced by the proxy Web Parts control.
Docs.value: A string containing the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> value of the Web Parts control replaced by the proxy Web Parts control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPart> object replaces a Web Parts control, the OriginalID property contains the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> of the replaced control. If the replaced control is a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.GenericWebPart> object, this property contains the ID from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.GenericWebPart.ChildControl%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the path to the user control being replaced.
Docs.value: A string that contains the path to a user control being replaced.

Docs.summary: Gets the <xref:System.Type> of the Web Parts control replaced by the proxy Web Parts control.
Docs.value: A string containing the <xref:System.Type> of the control replaced by the proxy Web Parts control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPart> object replaces a control, this property contains the <xref:System.Type> of the control that the proxy Web Parts control replaces.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance object SaveControlState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Saves any server control state changes that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server.
Docs.returns: Returns the server control's current state. If there is no state associated with the control, this method returns .

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance object SaveViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Saves any state that was modified after the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style.TrackViewState%2A> method was invoked.
Docs.returns: An object that contains the current view state of the control; otherwise, if there is no view state associated with the control, .
